description: From constant +‎ -ly. Displaced native Old English singallīċe.

adverbs.description: constantly (comparative more constantly, superlative most constantly)

entries.meaning: (archaic) With steadfastness; with resolve; in loyalty, faithfully.
examples: Agrippa and the rest of his weeping friends earnestly besought him […] not to offer violence unto himself, ‘with a settled resolution he desired again they would approve of his good intent, and not seek to dehort him from it’; and so constantly died.

entries.meaning: In a constant manner; occurring continuously; persistently.

examples: I find that I am constantly reminding you to feed your pets.

entries.meaning: In an unchangeable or invariable manner; in every case.
